newsitem.title: GERMANY: Audi, works council agree on sick-pay benefits.
newsitem.headline: Audi, works council agree on sick-pay benefits.

text.p: German luxury carmaker Audi AG said on Tuesday that it has reached a pact with its works council over the payment of sick pay under a controversial new law that took effect on Tuesday.

Audi said workers will be paid 100 percent of their wages while out sick. But 20 percent of the time lost will be recorded on a "time account" in which workers will accrue "time debts" for missed work.
Details of how the new system will be introduced and implemented will be discussed in upcoming wage talks, Audi said in a statement.
The new German law says workers will receive 80 percent of their gross pay while sick compared to the current system where workers receive 100 percent of their benefits.
Many major German carmakers have implemented the new law, sparking labour unrest and work stoppages on Tuesday in the car industry, including Mercedes-Benz and Adam Opel.
